meanings.definition: An advance or penetration into enemy territory.
meanings.sent1: The army made an inroad into the enemy's land.
meanings.sent2: The invaders launched a surprise inroad into the neighboring country.
meanings.sent3: The inroad of the ants into the picnic basket was quite unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The inroad of technology into our daily lives has been swift and profound.
meanings.sent5: The inroad of winter brought a blanket of snow overnight.

meanings.sent1: The inroad of the enemy troops caught us off guard.
meanings.sent2: The country defended itself against the inroad of enemy forces.
meanings.sent3: The inroad of the squirrels into the bird feeder caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The inroad of misinformation can be damaging to society.
meanings.sent5: The inroad of darkness enveloped the forest as night fell.

meanings.definition: A sudden or unexpected increase or advance.
meanings.sent1: The company made an inroad in sales after launching the new product.
meanings.sent2: The sudden inroad of customers overwhelmed the small shop.
meanings.sent3: The inroad of laughter during the serious meeting lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: The inroad of ideas sparked a creative revolution in the team.
meanings.sent5: The inroad of happiness brightened her day unexpectedly.
